intro: Wierzbickia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Wierzbickia africana, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its bark and latex have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. The genus is noted for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
